30.  
Administration of property by one spouse
 (1) If the right to administer joint property has been granted to one spouse pursuant to subsection 2 of § 28 of this Act, he or she is entitled to possess and dispose of an object forming part of joint property taking into account the restrictions prescribed for the benefit of the other spouse by law and by the marital property contract. A spouse who administers joint property alone shall conduct legal disputes related to joint property in his or her name.
 (2) The spouse who administers the property may dispose of or undertake to dispose of a dwelling used as a housing of the family or used separately by the spouse who is not the owner and grant the use thereof to a third party or terminate the legal relationship on which the use thereof is based only with the consent of the other spouse.
